intro: Monanthotaxis pilosa, commonly known as the hairy monanthotaxis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Araliaceae family, which includes other plants such as ginseng and ivy. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with a rough texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or greenish in color. Monanthotaxis pilosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
